page.title: 03SELBY ABBEY SCHOOL
page.content:
SELBY ABBEY SCHOOL STARTED AS A CHURCH SCHOOL PROVIDED FOR THE CHILDREN OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND. A PLAQUE IN THE HALL STATES: THIS CLASSROOM WAS BUILT BY PUBLIC SUBSCRIPTION IN MEMORY OF FRANCIS HARPER VICAR 1850-1888. BUILT IN 1896.
TODAY THINGS ARE VERY DIFFERENT AT SELBY ABBEY SCHOOL .THERE ARE 180 CHILDREN DIVIDED INTO SIX CLASSES.IT IS NO LONGER A SECONDARY SCHOOL AND IS NOW JUST PRIMARY.CHILDREN FROM THE ABBEY SCHOOL CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION AT SELBY OR BRAYTON HIGH SCHOOL. THERE WERE ONCE 600 CHILDREN AT THE ABBEY SCHOOL. IN 1981 THE SCHOOL WAS USED AS AN ARMY BASE WHEN SELBY WAS BADLY FLOODED.
